main.java.com.hexcore.vrmeeting_hostserver.connection

Class Connection

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.com.hexcore.vrmeeting_hostserver.connection.Connection
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MockConnection, TCPConnection

    public abstract class Connection
extends java.lang.Object
    A class extending this is able to send and receive packets in the form of byte arrays to and from an end point
    Author:
    Psymj1 (Marcus)

      Connection()

    • Constructor Detail

      • Connection

        public Connection()

    • Method Detail

      • receiveNextPacket

        public final byte[] receiveNextPacket()
                               throws ConnectionErrorException
        Get the next packet of data sent to the connection from the end point. Call may block if willReceiveBlock() is false
        Returns:
        Returns the next packet of data in a byte array or Null if there is no data to be read
        Throws:
        ConnectionErrorException - If there is an error has occurred with the connection such that it cannot perform any further actions

      • sendPacket

        public final void sendPacket(byte[] packet)
                      throws ConnectionErrorException
        Send a packet to the end point at the other end of the connection
        Parameters:
        packet - The packet to send to the connection endpoint
        Throws:
        ConnectionErrorException - If there is an error has occurred with the connection such that it cannot perform any further actions

      • willReceiveBlock

        public final boolean willReceiveBlock()
                               throws ConnectionErrorException
        Checks whether receiveNextPacket() will block, it does not guarantee that the call will not block
        Returns:
        Returns true if calling receiveNextPacket() will block
        Throws:
        ConnectionErrorException - If there is an error with the connection

      • getState

        public final ConnectionState getState()
        Returns:
        The current ConnectionState of the connection

      • setState

        public final void setState(ConnectionState state)

      • close

        public final void close()
                 throws ConnectionErrorException
        Closes the connection stopping any further packets from being sent or received. Has no effect if the connection is already closed or in an error state
        Throws:
        ConnectionErrorException - if the connection is already closed or in an error state

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen()
        Returns:
        True if the current state of the connection is ConnectionState.OPEN otherwise any other ConnectionState will return false

      • getName

        public abstract java.lang.String getName()
